intro: Alsinella hirta, commonly known as hairy alsinella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along coastal areas. Alsinella hirta is adapted to withstand drought conditions due to its water-storing tissues and hairy leaf surfaces that reduce water loss.
